moves.1. e4: After blundering multiple times in my first game against oags I vowed not to this time.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. O-O Nd4: Haven't seen this played in the Berlin Defence before
moves.7. e5 Bxe5 8. Re1 Qe7 9. Qe2 O-O 10. Qxe: Now a piece up I look to attack
moves.10... Qb4 11. c3: With ideas to free up my queen from defence of the bishop.
moves.13... Kh8 14. Bc4: Rd7 with pressure on the king
moves.16. Qf4 c5 17. Bd2 dxc3 18. Qxb4 cxb4 19: Black is equal on material but I have pressure on his Kingside. It's amazing how many blunders I made in the next few moves.
moves.21. Re7 b5 22. Bxf7 Ra6 23. Be8: Blunder 1: Rxe8 Bxf6 Rxe7 Bxe7 = material even. Nxe8 Bxg7+ Kg8 Bxf8 Kxf8 A rook for two pieces. However Nxe8 Bxg7 Nxg7 and I'm down
moves.24... b4 25. Bxb4: axb4 Rxc8 and White is at worst going to be even
moves.25... Bf5 26. Rc8: Blunder 2: I played on as if he had have captured instead I should have played Re1. Where if Ra8 Re5 with discovered attack on Rook + attack on bishop. Rook must move to g8 otherwise it will be mate. If Bg6 there is still some pressure on black
moves.26... Bxc8 27. Re4: Blunder 3: Looking to attack the Rf8 but I forgot that it is hanging
